description: Israeli fighter jets struck nuclear and military sites across Iran on Friday. The offensive, code-named 'Rising Lion,' was deemed 'very successful' by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

War in Ukraine: Russia steps up its offensive in the Donetsk region
description: Seizing complete control of the region − nearly one-third of which remains under Ukrainian control − has been a primary goal for the Kremlin. The arrival of summer has made it easier for Russian forces to advance.

headline: 'You've started a fire': TikTok execs fail to convince French lawmakers at hearing
description: On Thursday, several TikTok executives tried to reassure a parliamentary committee investigating the platform by outlining the measures implemented to protect minors.

headline: Paris Games balloon returns to French capital, minus the Olympic name
description: The balloon has been installed in the Tuileries Garden. It will rise into the sky with its electric flame on June 21.

headline: Two Jewish sisters' fight to honor the couple who hid them during the Holocaust
description: Arlette and Madeleine Testyler campaigned so that Jeanne and Jean Philippeau, who sheltered them during World War II, be recognized as Righteous Among the Nations. After some hesitation from the mayor, the town of Vendôme is organizing a ceremony on June 16 in which they will be honored by the Yad Vashem Institute.

description: Le Monde, Forbidden Stories and media partners investigated arbitrary arrests of Malians committed by Russian mercenaries. We reveal at least six bases where civilians were illegally detained and secretly tortured.

headline: The Dulcie September case exposes France's troubling ties with South Africa during apartheid
description: Thirty-seven years after the unsolved assassination of the African National Congress (ANC) representative in Paris, a French court on Tuesday dismissed her family's complaint against the state for 'denial of justice' and 'gross negligence.'

headline: 'In the war in Ukraine, territory is important, yes, but not as much as it seems'
description: Donald Trump believed that '24 hours' would be enough for him to resolve the war in Ukraine. He overlooked the root causes of the conflict, rooted in Vladimir Putin's ambition to reestablish a sphere of influence in Russia's near abroad, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.
